alert.note: Alert for Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 12:28PM EST until March 07 at 8:12AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River at Vincennes. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River at Riverton, Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site, Montezuma, and Mount Carmel. East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Hazleton and Petersburg. .Ongoing and renewed flooding will continue on the White, East Fork White, and Wabash Rivers. River flood stages are expected to rise again in the next few days as additional rainfall is expected tonight and tomorrow. Flooding on the lower portions of the Wabash and White rivers is currently forecast to last through much of the week, but could be extended based on expected rainfall over the next few days. Additional portions of these and other waterways not currently in flood may return to flood conditions early this week based on this expected rainfall. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Vincennes. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Some flooding at Kimmell Park in Vincennes. Agricultural lands flood in the St. Francisville, Illinois area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CST Sunday /11:45 AM EST Sunday/ the stage was 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM CST Sunday /11:45 AM EST Sunday/ was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this evening to 15.1 feet and then begin rising early Tuesday morning. It will then rise again to 15.7 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1130 PM CST /1230 AM EST/.
